answers.answer: Hey SoSleepy121.Welcome to the forum.I'm astonished!! You are probably one of the highest ranking individualsin number of diagnosed-I assume- autoimmune and chronic conditions!Yet, from your words, I get the impression, that you have a fighting spirit within you and the zest to seek solutions to get better.Your conditions have not put you down! Good for you.There are some useful elements to be explored, upon viewingyour situation from a  higher perspective .1.  At least one significant underlying and linked to most of your conditions pathogenic factor.2. Unresolved issues at the emotional/mental/spiritual level (perhaps you may not even be aware-as they may only exist in the subconscious).Hmm. Where to start?***Could you list any significant events as far back as you can remember, prior to the onset of your conditions?Could you also list tests, scans, symptoms, meds and how you got diagnosed for each of your conditions? question: I have so many autoimmune disorders (MS, Type 1 Diabetes, Celiacs, Hashimotos, Psoriosis) ... What is the best way to keep all of these in check?  One seems to mimic the other or cause another problems... sometimes the drugs associated with certain illnesses creates side effects or brings on other illnesses.  The last two years have been one thing on top of another on top of another.  I feel like I live in doctor's offices. How can I stop this trend and feel like I'm on a healthy road?  I've quit smoking, I've cut my stress levels, but, I continue to battle with my health.
title: So many autoimmune disorders
